thread.title: Mets: Set rotation for Dodgers series - Baseball
thread.title_full: Mets: Set rotation for Dodgers series - Baseball - NorthJersey.com

author: MATT EHALT
title: Mets: Set rotation for Dodgers series - Baseball
text:
NEW YORK — The team has aligned Jacob deGrom, Noah Syndergaard and Matt Harvey to start the first three games of the NLDS, with the possibility of deGrom and Syndergaard pitching multiple games.
Manager Terry Collins said the team arranged it that way because deGrom had the best season of the starters, and Harvey cannot pitch multiple games in the series.
If deGrom is brought back for Game 4 in the case Steven Matz (back stiffness) is unavailable, it would be on short rest. Syndergaard likely would start Game 5 on regular rest in a scenario without Matz.
"I’ve never done it before, but I’m willing. Anything to help us win," said deGrom, who threw four scoreless innings in Sunday’s 1-0 win. "I think I’ll be ready on short rest."
Matz could round out the rotation and start Game 4. He’ll have a long throwing session today, a bullpen session Tuesday, and if all goes well he’ll start an instructional league game Thursday in Port St. Lucie, Fla.
"Hopefully he’ll throw 90, 95 pitches, and it will all be determined by how he comes out [today] and Tuesday," Collins said. "We’re prepared for him to be ready or for him not to be ready."
URIBE QUESTIONABLE: Collins said it’s "iffy" that Juan Uribe will be on the NLDS roster. Uribe has been sidelined with a chest injury and has yet to do any physical activity. He originally suffered a chest contusion Sept. 20, then aggravated the injury Sept. 25 and hasn’t played since.
ROSTER MOVES: Anthony Recker, Bobby Parnell, Logan Verrett, Eric Young Jr. and Eric Campbell will not be on the postseason roster, but are heading to Port St. Lucie to work out in case they are summoned.
BRIEFS: The team won 90 games for the 11th time in franchise history. It was 49-32 at home. ... DeGrom became the 11th pitcher in Mets history to record 200 strikeouts in a season. ... The .618 winning percentage against NL East foes was the best intra-division mark in baseball.
